page.title: 10MEETING PLACES IN HARLINGTON
page.content: Harlington has a friendly and active village community.{Bury Orchard},a pleasant recreation area, is protected by Trustees. Around this area are the meeting places. On the Parish Lands are the {Scout H.Q.},the{Village Hall, a playground and pitches used the Sports Association with plans for a pavilion. On the northern side of the area are the {Parish Rooms}, converted from the old school, dated 1873. The { {Parish Church }dating from 1320 is being renovated and decorated. In Sundon Road are the{Methodist Chapel} and hall built in 1928 and the two old public houses, the 17th. century {Old Sun}and the{Carpenter's Arms}. The old coal office by the station is a unique{Village Archive Office}.The Harlington Heritage Trust plan a larger Archive Office and Museum.
